Case reference: 2018039302.CaseDesc: On February 17, 1992, at approximately 9:00 am, Glen Levy was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Prior to his disappearance, Glen had attempted to travel by bus to visit his father in Florida, USA.

Coat: Nylon, Black, Parka, green trim, 3/4 length

Case reference: 2005006599.CaseDesc:
On September 18, 1978, the body of an unidentified man was found in the Toronto Harbour of Lake Ontario. His post-mortem weight was 163lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.
Staining on his teeth suggest that he may have been a smoker. It is estimated that he had been in the water for several weeks.

Teeth: Stained, Overbite & several amalgam fillings. Several teeth lost/extracted during life; lower right lateral incisor being most obvious.

Case reference: 2014005999.CaseDesc: On February 5, 2013, at approximately 3:00 p.m., Quincy Blackburn was seen for the last time when his sister dropped him off at the Toronto Person International Airport in Toronto, Ontario. Quincy boarded a flight to Trinidad and was scheduled to return on February 19, but did not board the flight.

Pants: Red, White, TRACK, Track pants; Brand: Adidas
Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Earrings, Square diamond earrings

Case reference: 2021043326.CaseDesc: In the evening of September 20, 2021, Jeremiah Guthro was seen for the last time as he walked away from his residence in the Glebe neighbourhood in Ottawa, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014003940.CaseDesc: On August 30, 1999, Dana Zelic was seen for the last time at her mother's residence located in Hamilton, Ontario. Dana was known to have connections in the Greater Toronto area and in Brooklyn, New York, in the United States. At the time of her disappearance, Dana left her mother’s home without her medication, identification or personal belongings. All efforts to locate her have returned negative results.

Mark: Left Side Of Neck, Brown beauty mark

Case reference: 2014004330.CaseDesc: On the 27th of December, 2002, at approximately 9 a.m., Jaroslav Heindl was last seen by the Lakeshore IGA Food Store in Regina, SK. Mr. Heindl was known to collect discarded items from around stores and other locations. His vehicle was located nearby, however, searches and investigations have failed to locate him.

Case reference: 2020004223.CaseDesc: On December 24, 2019, Ryan Docherty was seen for the last time by his family in London, Ontario. The last known contact between Ryan and his friends was during the last week of December. On March 6, 2020, his mother reported him missing after returning from an extended trip, and noticing that Ryan had not shown up at her residence to retrieve some cheques.

Tattoo: Upper Back, Words: "EAZY-E"; gun and bullet
Left Hand, A heart with the name "Jodi"
Left Wrist, 6 eyes inside a triangle
Chest, Doc and Pennywise the clown
Scar: Right Hand, 3 inches on the top

Case reference: 2014004876.CaseDesc: In 1999, Fathiya Mohamed was seen for the last time. Fathiya and her family had emigrated from Somalia to England and to different parts of Canada.

Case reference: 2006010599.CaseDesc: William Wabie was last seen as he departed in his 16 foot Starcraft boat from Bag Bay Peninsula, Shoal Lake, near Kenora, Ontario.  Mr. Wabie never arrived at his destination of Cedar Island.

Hat: Straw, Feather on the on side

Case reference: 2014004672.CaseDesc: On the 13th of June, 1995, Marcel Legris and a friend were last seen fishing on Cold Lake, SK. A large storm suddenly came up and it is believed swamped the boat they were using. The friend’s body was located, however, Mr. Legris was never found.

Case reference: 2006001599.CaseDesc:
On July 15, 1992, the remains of an adult male, were found in the basement apartment of an abandoned residential building on 1348 Yonge Street in Toronto. 
There were multiple whiskey and wine bottles found around him as well as multiple cigarette butts. Based on autopsy findings and an LCBO receipt dated November 1990, it is believed that this individual had been dead for 10-18 months prior to discovery.

Teeth: Poor dental hygiene with numerous dental cavities and abscesses. He has some amalgam fillings that appear to be quite old.
Jacket: Blue, "Mark's Work Wearhouse" brand winter coat
Scar: Previous brain surgery on the right side of his head. (Craniotomy)

Case reference: 2012020142.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2008, Shannon Alexander, 17 and Maisy Odjick, 16, were reported missing from the First Nation community of Kitigan Zibi in Quebec. This community is located near the town of Maniwaki. On September 5, 2008, the two girls went to the Maniwaki arena, where several young people were present. Maisy then went to spend the night at Shannon’s house. Shannon’s father was the last person to have seen his daughter on September 6, 2008. In 2015 an age progression was done for both Maisy and Shannon.

Pierce: Mouth, 2 loops on the lower lip

Case reference: 2014004819.CaseDesc: Reginald Andrew FLETT (known as Reggie) was last seen walking around downtown Thompson, Manitoba shortly before his disappearance on either September 16th or 17th, 2007. FLETT had also been spotted earlier near both the Thompson Walmart and the Extra Foods. He was reported as missing by a family member on September 19, 2006.   Shortly thereafter, family members from Split Lake, Manitoba conducted searches around both Split Lake and Thompson, both of which failed to uncover any trace of FLETT. Thereafter, missing persons posters were distributed throughout Thompson. Although FLETT's whereabouts remain unknown, the investigation is ongoing.

Case reference: 2014004253.CaseDesc: On October 13, 2000, two boats were on the Churchill River headed to Granville Lake. One of the boats began taking on water and experiencing motor problems. Most of the occupants of the disabled boat boarded another boat. Mr. Linklater however stayed on the disabled boat attempting to start it. The missing boat was located the next day, however Mr. Linklater was not aboard. He is presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2020007369.CaseDesc: On October 14, 1981, at approximately 9:00pm, May Mah was last seen by her nurse in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005302.CaseDesc: On November 11, 2005, in Toronto, Canada, Zaina Trujillo-Talib was abducted by her father, Chaudhry Talib and her paternal grandmother, Shama Talib.  Chaudhry and Shama immediately took six-year-old Zaina to their family home located in Lahore, Pakistan.  Since this time, Zaina's mother has not been allowed to have any contact with her daughter.

Case reference: 2021006608.CaseDesc: On July 4,2020, Anna Marquart was last seen by her husband and her sister as she walked away from her residence in Glenboro, Manitoba.

Case reference: 2013000010.CaseDesc: On December 3rd 1996, family members of Jaime Wyatt made a report to the St-John's RCMP that he had not been seen since November 12th, 1996. Mr. Wyatt, a resident of Newfoundland, left the province in September 1996 to seek employment in Nova Scotia. The investigation revealed that Jaime Wyatt had been staying at the Twin Elms Motel on Inglis Street in Halifax and he was last seen there on November 16th, 1996. His motel room was paid in full until the 17th of November 1996. On the evening of November 16th, 1996, Mr. Wyatt informed the staff at the Twin Elms that someone was going to be picking him up to go out to a dinner party and other functions that evening. Mr. Wyatt was never heard from or seen since that day. Foul play is suspected.

Case reference: 2014005330.CaseDesc: On September 13, 2009, at approximately 6:30 a.m., Rose Mackinnon was seen for the last time when she left the Earnestine Women’s shelter with her two children. Rose advised that she would be returning but has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014004895.CaseDesc: Desmond Peter's grandmother saw him for the last time on March 6, 2007, she reported him missing a few days later. Desmond was not happy with his home life and would often leave the house for days, but he would always return.  During the first year of his disappearance there were several unconfirmed sightings of Desmond, however none of them were considered reliable enough to confirm his whereabouts.  All tips and information brought to the investigators continues to be followed up on.

Case reference: 2018013207.CaseDesc: On the morning of March 12, 2018, Ariel Kouakou left his home, on foot, to go to a friend’s house. At around 11:15 am, a witness walking a dog saw Ariel on the bicycle path in Park of la Merci located between Gouin Boulevard and the Rivière des Prairies.

Case reference: 2014004918.CaseDesc: On September 15th, 1993, three men were en route to Wuskwatim Lake via the Burntwood River intending to engage in commercial fishing. The men departed Nelson House, according to the only survivor they hit a rock and the motor quit. The boat was not equipped with a starter and the men were unable to restart the boat prior to going through the rapids.   Despite an intensive land, water and air search the bodies of Mr. Moose and Mr. Spence were never recovered.

Case reference: 2014001648.CaseDesc: On August 31, 1986, Gustave Focktave was seen for the last time when he left his home in the Côte-Des-Neiges-Notre-Dame-De-Grâce District of Montreal, Quebec. Gustave had left without his possessions and had left a farewell letter addressed to his family indicating that he would be hitchhiking to British Columbia to live in Vancouver. Gustave is originally from Madagascar.

Case reference: 2017056443.CaseDesc: Kristina Ward is a 20 years old aboriginal female who has been missing since September 27, 2017. Kristina is schizophrenic and is possibly using drugs. Kristina is developmentally delayed and is described as being vulnerable and easily trust people she does not know.  Kristina has money and a cellphone, however, neither have been used or accessed since September 27, 2017. Kristina was last seen in Surrey at the intersection of 104th Avenue and 144th St. with an unidentified male.

Mark: Upper Lip, Birthmark on upper left lip

Case reference: 2012020653.CaseDesc: On May 12, 2003, Patsy Haysom was last seen when she was dropped off at the back of her residence by a friend.

Shoes: Red, Blue, BUM Equipment Logo, Slip on

Case reference: 2021023515.CaseDesc: On September 1, 2015, the remains of an unidentified man were found in a wooded area on Vincent Massey Road in Rawdon, Quebec. Anthropological analysis suggests that he was of Caucasian descent, between the ages of 16 and 25, and that he had died between 1990 and 2010.

Sweater: Grey, Hooded Sweatshirt, Nike brand, size XXL
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Upper Arm, Possible previous injury to left humerus bone

Case reference: 2006024199.CaseDesc: Diane Cudmore was last seen on February 22, 1972, before she wandered away from her home. Diane was known to have mental health issues that may have played a part in her disappearance.

Case reference: 2018063054.CaseDesc: On June 1, 2018, Djvaid Ashami was seen for the last time as he left Montreal, Quebec, to go to Germany to join his father. On July 5, 2018, Djvaid and his father left Germany to go to the Shahre Naow District in Kabul, Afghanistan. The duo had planned to stay there until July 14. However, on July 11, Djavid left his hotel room for unknown reasons and without telling his father he was leaving. He has not been seen and his family has not heard from him since.

Case reference: 2014001233.CaseDesc: On September 15, 2013, the remains of an Asian or mixed race male were discovered in Kananaskis County near Highway 40. The individual may have had episodes of malnutrition or anemia.

Case reference: 2019044701.CaseDesc: On August 5, 2019, at approximately 6:00 am, Bridget Dalbe was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2022018770.CaseDesc: On May 2, 2022, a female child between the age of 4 to 7 years old was discovered at 25 Dale Avenue, in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2015066998.CaseDesc:
Yvon Shawn Guignard moved to the northern part of Manitoba during the summer of 2015 in search of employment, with interests in Churchill and the Northwest Territories. While in Thompson, he adopted a transient lifestyle, living in his personal vehicle and developing friendships with the homeless community. 
It’s believed Mr. Guignard was last seen on November 28, 2015 at approximately 6:45am. Just prior to his disappearance, he made a number of attempts to give away his personal vehicle, which was located at the time he was reported missing. According to his family, he is schizophrenic, with a medical condition and he also has a history of not taking his prescription medications. He has been known to travel to undisclosed locations within the country and act secretive with family as to his whereabouts. He should not be approached as he may be in medical distress.

Case reference: 2013000089.CaseDesc: Daniel Marceau was last seen on June 7, 1989 in Montréal. He was despondent, and told a friend that he was going up north to reflect on his life.

Case reference: 2014000020.CaseDesc: Lorraine Roach was last seen at home at approximately 1:30 a.m. on May 11, 2013, by her husband. He indicated that she was upset over a family matter and was heading to the local casino. She left driving her vehicle, which was later found parked on the side of the road near a walking trail about 7 kilometers from her home. She never went to the casino that evening.

Pierce: Ears, both ears have 3 piercings with diamond studs

Case reference: 2006012399.CaseDesc: On June 3, 2003, an unidentified man was discovered in the Ottawa River, near the Ottawa Rowing Club, in Ottawa, Ontario.

Shirt: Blue, Black, Long sleeve, Plaid; flannel; size extra large

Case reference: 2014006218.CaseDesc: Lori Kasprick, who sometimes went by "Lovey", was last seen in the mid-1970s.  She was from Hilliard and going to school in Mundare when last seen.  Lori may have had ties to Tofield and Ryley.  Her grandparents lived in Holden at that time, and Lori could have made acquaintance with others her age when going to visit.

Case reference: 2014004896.CaseDesc: On September 22, 2002, Aiqiu Chen was seen for the last time as she was leaving her brother’s home in Toronto, Ontario. Aiqiu left with all of her belongings.

Case reference: 2020010931.CaseDesc: On November 14, 1987, at approximately 10:20am, Farad Khan was seen for the last time leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Farad had left his home following an argument with his wife.

Case reference: 2014001757.CaseDesc: On January 12, 1987, Patricia Hutton was seen for the last time in the Saint-Léonard district of Montreal, Quebec. She had an appointment at a daycare center on the corner of Beaubien and Langelier for a job, but never attended. Patricia hasn’t been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014005084.CaseDesc: On February 1, 2008, it is suspected the Kevin Leroux went through the ice on his ATV, near St Joseph's Cove, NL. His ATV was recovered several months later, about 22 km from where he was suspected of going through the ice but his body was never found.

Case reference: 2020010648.CaseDesc: On September 9, 1992, at approximately 9:00pm, Harry White was seen for the last time as he left his father’s residence in Toronto, Ontario. Harry’s boat was later found in Bluffer’s Park with the engine still running.

Case reference: 2020015970.CaseDesc: On August 31, 2017, John Spratt was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. John is known to be homeless, and has been diagnosed with some serious health issues. John would always check in with his family every couple of years, however, they have not heard from him since 2017.

Case reference: 2018060326.CaseDesc: On June 10, 2018, sisters Bérénice and Bérengère Paré were last seen at the Ottawa International Airport in Ottawa, Ontario. Bérénice and Bérengère, along with their mother, boarded a flight destined for Russia to visit with family. To date, the siblings have not been returned to Canada.

Case reference: 2014003825.CaseDesc: Ruby Ann Hardy was reported missing by her brother in 2002. She was last seen in the downtown east side of Vancouver in June 1997, and was engaged in a high risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2017013180.CaseDesc: On March 1, 2017, at approximately 9:00 p.m., Maryam Mehrvarz and Kian Norouzian were seen last seen together in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005585.CaseDesc: In December 2010, Amanda McLeod was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014006175.CaseDesc: On July 8, 2013, at approximately 5:30 a.m., Jason Bathily and his twin sister, Clarene Bathily, were seen for the last time with their mother, Adelyne Mounga, in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005313.CaseDesc: On September 24, 2007, Azelea Brown last spoke to her mother who was overseas.

Case reference: 2022031763.CaseDesc: Shortly after midnight on December 27, 1980, Paul Elliott was seen for the last time near the Table Rock in Niagara Falls, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Paul was despondent.

Pants: Brown, Corduroy, May have been wearing corduroy pants
Blue, JEANS, May have been wearing jeans
Shirt: Blue, T-SHIRT, The brand may have possibly been Levis

Case reference: 2006022099.CaseDesc: Duane Wicklund and Edward Kotula were last seen on October 7, 1967, in a loaded boat on Sturgeon Lake. They were vacationing in the area and heading to Margaret Resort on Harris Bay. Neither has been seen since and both are presumed to have drowned.

Scar: Nose, from nose to upper lip

Case reference: 2019054192.CaseDesc: Danick Bourgeois was seen for the last time during the month of July 2019. He has been known to reside in a homemade trailer in St. Bernadin, Ontario and in a tent near Hawkesbury, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002212.CaseDesc: On July 30, 1996, Betty Primeau was last seen while berry picking in the Torch River area near Choiceland, SK. Mrs. Primeau was with a group of other individuals prior to being reported missing. Extensive searches have failed to locate Mrs. Primeau.

Case reference: 2017009362.CaseDesc: Badri Prasad Bhattarai, was reported missing on February 21, 2017, after his family became concerned that he had not been in contact with them. It is believed that Mr. Bhattarai’s last known location was in the area of the Walterdale Bridge, Edmonton. Mr. Bhattarai’s disappearance is out of character, and as a result, there are concerns for his well-being.

Ring: Gold, With 3 small clear stones worn on the left ring finger
Chain: Black, Volkswagen Key Fob, House, Locker and mailbox keys
Key Ring with the letter "R" and a Swedish Flag
Scar: Black dots, diabetes scars on both shins

Case reference: 2018052183.CaseDesc: In March 2017, the partial remains of a middle-aged male were found in the Skeena River near Terrace, British Columbia. The unidentified male had moderate arthritis in his lower back and is likely to have died many years before his remains were found.

Case reference: 2020011471.CaseDesc: On February 2, 1975, at approximately 9:00 am, Stella Zayats was last seen by her husband as she left her residence to go for a walk in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2016060405.CaseDesc: On April 24, 1976, a male, believed to be between the ages of 18 to 30, was recovered from the Niagara River, near the Canadian Niagara Power Plant. He is estimated to have been in the water from 3 to 6 weeks, possibly longer.

Teeth: Good, He has good teeth and no dental restorations.

Case reference: 2006012599.CaseDesc: Ralph Grant was last seen in the Huntsville area between January 28 and February 22, 1999. He resided on Yearly Road, Huntsville.

Amputation: Lower jaw surgically removed due to cancer

Case reference: 2021056669.CaseDesc: On September 1, 2016, the remains of an unidentified man were recovered from Porcupine Strand, near Cartwright, Newfoundland. He may have been of Indigenous or Caucasian ancestry.

Case reference: 2021006090.CaseDesc: At the end of July, 2019, Jonathan Fowler was seen for the last time in Picton, Ontario. Since then, there has not been any activity on his banking, phone and social media accounts. During the time of his disappearance, Jonathan was engaged in a high risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2019062090.CaseDesc: On October 26, 2019, Maysa Nouasri was last seen with her father, Larbi Nouasri, in the borough of Saint-Léonard in Montreal, Quebec. It is believed that the two have travelled to Algeria, without Maysa’s mother’s consent.

Case reference: 2014006004.CaseDesc: On February 1, 2013, Timmothy Benedict-Leaf was last seen at his family residence in Akwesasne, Ontario.

Case reference: 2013000049.CaseDesc: On May 9, 2008, Jean-Francois Rousseau was seen for the last time near the Mont-Tremblant park in Quebec.

Shirt: Blue, White, Plaided dark and doubled
Scar: Forehead, vertical in the middle of the forehead

Case reference: 2020008364.CaseDesc: On December 19, 1982, at approximately 10:30 am, Simon Yefronovich was seen for the last time by his friend as he left his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Simon was scheduled to fly to Vancouver, British Columbia, with his friend, but he never boarded the flight.

Case reference: 2016066066.CaseDesc: On November 23, 2016, at approximately 5:00 p.m., Kevin Dilk was seen for the last time as he left his residence in Winnipeg, Manitoba. Kevin has not been seen or heard from since this time.

Case reference: 2014005179.CaseDesc: On September 20, 2006, Richard Griffis was seen for the last time when he went down to the White River in the remote community of Beaver Creek in the Yukon. Richard had been visiting from the United States, and had travelled to the Yukon to test out an outdoor survival suit that he invented.

Case reference: 2019020557.CaseDesc: On April 20, 2019, at 9:00 pm, Rebecca Dorman was last seen leaving a friend's residence located at the intersection of Mohawk Road East and Upper Wellington Street in Hamilton, Ontario. Rebecca had been staying with her friend, and left the residence without her shoes, purse, phone or keys.

Case reference: 2015050774.CaseDesc: On August 31, 2015, at approximately 12:00 p.m., Mazen Malik was last seen in the Sheppard Avenue West and Allen Road area in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006009599.CaseDesc: Elizabeth Ann Kant has been missing since October 16, 1972. She had been with a hunting party in Adair Township, approximately 73 miles east of Cochrane and was last seen about 2.4 miles south of Camp # 23, Abitibi limits.

Jewelry: Gold, White, Yellow, ring; wedding band
Jacket: Black, Red, men's plaid hunting jacket
Pants: Green, Ski slacks with elastic strap under the feet
Scar: Right Foot, from bone spur surgery

Case reference: 2014001690.CaseDesc: On December 7, 1971, James MacDonald departed Thompson, Manitoba in his "Money Mark 21" aircraft bound for Winnipeg. James never arrived. Despite intensive air search neither Mr. MacDonald nor his aircraft have been located.

Jewelry: Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, engineering ring
Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Calendar watch

Case reference: 2021022385.CaseDesc: On May 28, 2021, Kienan Tran was reported missing from his residence in West St. Paul, Manitoba. In May, a representative from property management entered Kienan’s residence and noticed that it was vacant. Additional details revealed that Kienan was engaged in a high-risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2014005713.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1980, Michael Konopekly was seen for the last time when he went fishing on Pallet Lake, near Cochrane, Ontario. Mr. Konopekly’s canoe, paddle and fishing rod were located at the lake, but Mr. Konopekly was not located.

Case reference: 2017008453.CaseDesc: On September 7, 2015, Lorne Parkes was last seen in Kelowna, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014005122.CaseDesc: Phillip Morin was last seen in the Colony Street area. Mr. Morin's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2012020143.CaseDesc: Lucie Bouchard was last seen on October 23, 1996, driving her 1994 purple Honda Civic. Around 9:45 p.m., she dropped her sister off at the corner of Saint-Michel boulevard and Cremazie East. She was then supposed to head home to Brossard, on the south shore of Montreal, but never made it. She suffers from epilepsy and requires medication. She may have, on average, 2 to 3 epileptic seizures per month.

Case reference: 2014002473.CaseDesc: On July 4, 1991, Gabriel Bukredji was seen for the last time in the Saint-Leonard district of Montreal, Quebec. Gabriel was despondent and had also mentioned he was interested in purchasing property in another country.

Sweater: Pink, Blue circle on the back.

Case reference: 2020006473.CaseDesc: On April 22, 1967, at approximately 6:00pm, Roy Debone was last seen by his landlord in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2019072428.CaseDesc: In April of 2019, Corey Baldwin was seen for the last time in Ottawa, Ontario. It is out of character for Corey not to contact his father for an extended period of time. It is possible that Corey may be in British Columbia or Montreal, Quebec.

Tattoo: Middle Back, Dragon on entire back
Left Arm, Sleeve with a graffiti wreath
Right Arm, Cartoon wolf with a police hat
Right Arm, A full sleeve to the elbow
Left Upper Arm, Inside left bicep written "I love her"
Scar: Chest, 2-3 Inches, a horizontal deep scar on the sternum
Lower Back, Surgical scar, horseshoe shape on the tailbone

Case reference: 2014004704.CaseDesc: On the morning of March 24, 2000, René Rosa was seen for the last time at his residence in La Minerve, Quebec. On this day, at approximately 2:40 p.m., René’s vehicle, a 1996 purple Chevrolet Cavalier, was found abandoned near Montée Charette in La Minerve. René has not been seen and we have not heard from him since.

Jewelry: Silver, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Engraved bracelet
Tattoo: Upper Back, Naked woman and atomic mushroom cloud

Case reference: 2020011788.CaseDesc: On May 22, 1982, Ian Shim was seen for the last time when he checked into the Gran Hotel in Pereira, Columbia. He allegedly went for a hike and never returned to his room to collect his personal belongings. Ian was on a vacation in Colombia, but lived in Toronto, Ontario. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014002692.CaseDesc: Between September 3 and October 3, 1978, Jean-Jacques Sirois was seen for the last time in the Rosemont District in Montreal, Quebec. Jean-Jacques has not been seen or heard from since.

Jewelry: Gold, Gold ring with rectangular cubic zirconia

Case reference: 2014005451.CaseDesc: John W. Burton along with two passengers (Clifford Dowson and Edward Flett) were flying from Oxford House to Island Lake. Mr. Burton was the pilot of the Cessna 185. Around 11:00 am Mr. Burton made a routine call stating that the airplane would be landing in Garden Hill in approximately 15 minutes. The airplane did not arrive at its destination. The wreckage and all three on board were never located.

Case reference: 2008005898.CaseDesc: Paul Tenke left his family home on his mountain bike.  He had been under psychiatric care and had medication with him.  He was reported missing by his father.

Scar: Head, on face from recent accident

Case reference: 2021008992.CaseDesc: On March 7, 2021, Konstantin Boukhanov travelled to Toronto, Ontario without telling his family. Konstantin has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2013000034.CaseDesc: Lucie Constantineau was last seen on July 25, 2008 in the Parc-Extension in Montreal, Quebec. Lucie was engaged in a high risk lifestyle.

Teeth: Braces, partial denture on the 4 front teeth of the upper jaw
Amputation: Right Ear, Missing part of an ear lobe

Case reference: 2006023399.CaseDesc: John Allen Bowes was last seen in Nipigon, Ontario getting gasoline on August 15, 1992. He was travelling eastbound toward his home in Kingston, Ontario. Mr. Bowes usually wears a baseball cap.

Case reference: 2008004699.CaseDesc: Adave Francis was last seen October 12, 1999, at 6:00 p.m. riding his bicycle on the farm property located at Poplar side road in the Collingwood area. Mr. Francis was a seasonal worker from Jamaica.

Case reference: 2017021635.CaseDesc: On April 24th, 2017, Kevin Sadownyk was last seen in Okotoks, Alberta. Kevin’s truck was found abandoned just outside of Banff, Alberta the next day.

Case reference: 2012020170.CaseDesc: An adult male was washed up along the south side of the beach at Stanley Park, near the 2000 block of Beach Avenue at English Bay in Vancouver.

Wallet: Black, Contained pliers and a jack knife
Mark: Forehead, Post mortem abrasion on the right side of the forehead

Case reference: 2018045881.CaseDesc: In July of 2018 Tatianna Cuevas was taken on vacation by her father John Varga from Toronto, Ontario to Paris, France. It is the belief that she was abducted by her father as they have not returned to Canada on the agreed upon date.

Case reference: 2014001366.CaseDesc: On April 19, 1995, Paul-Henri Hardy was seen for the last time in the St-Romuald sector of Lévis, Quebec. Paul-Henry was 28 years old at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2013000015.CaseDesc: On November 6, 1968, Robert Lessard went onto the Ottawa River in a boat, travelling to a hunting camp. He never arrived and the boat was located on the river.

Case reference: 2014001607.CaseDesc: On August 4, 1979, Joseph Cohen was seen for the last time in Montreal. It was a Saturday night, he was out with friends at the Blanche Neige restaurant located in Côte-des-Neiges. His vehicle was located in a parking lot facing Valois Road.

Case reference: 2012020111.CaseDesc: On July 15 2010, James Daniel Khan left the family home for a walk and never returned. He suffers from mental health problems and he left without his medication.

Case reference: 2014006384.CaseDesc: On January 7, 2014, at approximately 12:20 a.m., Yinghui Zhu was seen for the last time at her family’s restaurant in Toronto, Ontario. Yinghui was supposed to open the restaurant the next day but did not show up.

Coat: Black, Winter, Winter jacket; Brand: Lacoste

Case reference: 1996003690.CaseDesc: On August 29, 1994, Angela Arseneault was reported missing by her common law spouse. She was last seen on August 19, 1994, they and another male went shopping. Later that day, Angela left to catch a bus home alone. When her common law spouse returned home, the lights were on in the apartment, a window was left open and Angela’s purse was in the kitchen. Angela has not been seen since.

Tattoo: Left Ankle, rose and stem (6 inches long)

Case reference: 2020024716.CaseDesc: In August 1975, David Bleaney was seen for the last time in Charleston, West Virginia, in the United States. David was born in Ontario, Canada but had moved to the United States. David failed to show up for a court ordered appearance to answer to charges of arson in Charleston. David’s family suspect that he fled back to Canada.

Case reference: 2018053584.CaseDesc: On May 15, 1996, at approximately 1:30 p.m., Esther Adam was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Esther had made arrangements to meet with a friend on May 18, at 10:00 a.m., but did not attend.

Mark: Nose, Blue mark on bridge of nose

Case reference: 2014003086.CaseDesc: On January 30, 1997, Maurizio Di Caprio was last seen in Montreal. He left for Chicoutimi or Toronto to bring a vehicle back to Montreal.

Case reference: 2014001837.CaseDesc: On September 29, 1979 at approximately 8:30 a.m. seven men departed from Anama Bay, Manitoba on a fishing trip. The men departed as a group in three separate boats and were heading for Warpath. At approximately 7:30 p.m. that same day, the occupants of the first boat reported to the RCMP that the other two boats were missing. They described the waves as being three to four feet high and they could not see the tree line from where they were. They lost sight of the other two boats and fired shotgun shots into the air hoping for a response. No response was received. Extensive patrols by air, boat and land were made in an attempt to locate the remaining five men. The bodies of Fredrick Ursu and Jerry Hudy were never recovered. Mr. Ursu and Mr. Hudy are presumed dead due to drowning.
